title: Route menu actions start immediately on GTK (lp:#1835672)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1835672) created by **Ian McInerney (imcinerney)**
```
When you select "Route Single Track" from the Route menu in the menu bar,
it immediately places the first point in the trace where the mouse is
(which is outside the editor window).

Also, when you select "Route Differential Pair" from the route menu, it
immediately gives you a dialog saying that you cannot route it in the
middle of nowhere.

It seems these two actions are actually trying to start routing a trace
immediately rather than wait for the user to click the mouse in the board
editor.

title: Vias not connecting to zones in Eagle import (lp:#1835656)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1835656) created by **Steven Falco (stevenfalco)**
```
I am trying to import an Adafruit Eagle project into KiCAD 6 (built from
the current tip of the 6.0 master tree).

I placed a copy of the Eagle files and the conversion here:

https://www.dropbox.com/sh/6d5bqhsvwmjvta0/AACFjeWxfUAb73uTdmt5wNHNa?dl=0

The schematic looks pretty good, but there seems to be a problem with
filled zones in the pcb.  Specifically, there are a bunch of unrouted
traces, where vias should be connected to a zone.

Also, if I select "Show filled areas of zones", the zones remain as just an
outline rather than being colored in.

I posted this on the mailing list, and got a reply from Seth stating that
it is a bug whereby "nets are not propagating".
```

title: Highlight collisions or shove when dragging unconnected items (lp:#1835606)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1835606) created by **Piotr Gałka (piotrgalka)**
```
Rather wish then bug.
Learning to use KiCad 5.1.2 I found that if:
- I set Highligh collisions Mode,
- I set Mouse drag behaviour to Interactive drag,
then when I put via anywhere where it gets GND net (not important exactly
the net) and then when click that via with mouse (selecting it) and then
grab it to place at another position then colisions highlights. Super - I
didn't found it yesterday even I was searching for such behaviour.

But. When I do the same with any element then its colisions are not
highlighted.
Also if Shove mode is selected and mouse to Interactive drag then dragging
via or element don't activate shoving.

I was thinking about element unconnected yet, but I understand that
elements like to be connected complicating the dragging of them and makeing
it a big work to be done.

But why not make dragging of unconnected elements first (dragging in sense
that colisions are highlighted or tracks pushed) - it would help to
position next set of elements as close as possible to already done part of
PCB.

I think that collisions could be highlighted always when they take place -
even for Move (not Drag) function.
```

title: Footprint placed on bottomside shows also on bottom side in 3D-Model Editor (lp:#1835479)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1835479) created by **Urs Obernolte (urs-obernolte)**
```
If you place a footprint on the bottomside of a board and want to change
the 3D-model afterwards for that single footprint, the editor misbehaves.

How to reproduce:

1. Place a footprint on the backside
2. Press "e"
3. Switch to 3D Settings
4. On a SMD footprint u only see a green board cause it is also on the
bottomside in the editor

The rotation and offset values behave exactly like if they are placed on
the topside, its just a display problem.

[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1835460) created by **Ian McInerney (imcinerney)**
```
The submenus that involve check-box selections in each program all have
their width too small to contain all the text (see attached image). It
seems the width is being set by the checkbox and is ignoring the label. I
have noticed that after causing the submenu to open, close, then open
again, it will resize to fit all the text.


pcbnew:

- Preferences  -> Set Language

eeschema:

- Preferences -> Set Language

And more menus in the other programs...

title: MacOS CMD+Q quits everything (lp:#1835454)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1835454) created by **ocb-hd-ccb (ocb-hd-ccb)**
```
Request:

Go back to previous functionality where "CMD + Q" closes just the currently
focused application: Eeschema, PCBNew, GerbView, ect.

Current functionality is "CMD + Q" quits all of Kicad and associated
applications.

Acceptable compromise: Implement "CMD + W" to close current window and "CMD
+ Q" to quit everything. although since they are separate applications this
would seem very foreign to the normal MacOS way.

title: pcbnew: "Delete" does not work when selection is ambiguous (lp:#1835371)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1835371) created by **Giorgio Croci Candiani (g-crocic)**
```
When routing track tool ("x" key) is active, but no track is currently
being drawn, pressing "del" while pointing a track appears not to work.

It is easy to verify that this happens when the selection of the underlying
elements is not unambiguous: in fact, doing the same when the tool is not
active, the selection menu for the target element appears.

I think it is straightforward that the same menu should appear even when
the tool is active.

I didn't notice if this also happens with other tools; however I can say
that the behaviour is there from quite a few releases, not new to this one.

title: simulating laser_driver on macos nightly causes segfault (lp:#1835296)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1835296) created by **Christian Conkle (conklech)**
```
Running the 20190703 nightly MacOS build (which I believe has the new
ngspice-30 library, although I don't know how to check), simulating the
laser_driver or sallen_key demo project causes a hard crash of the entire
KiCad application. In particular, pressing "Run/Stop Simulation" causes a
segmentation fault in libngspice.0.dylib. Stack trace and version
information below.

The other two demo simulation projects (rectifier, pspice) do not crash,
and seem to give sensible simulation results.

The most obvious difference between the crashing (laser_driver, sallen_key)
and working (rectifier, pspice) projects is that the crashing projects
include external spice model libraries (e.g. ad8009.lib in laser_driver)
and the working projects use only internal models. My own projects seem to
crash if they include external models, but I haven't systematically tested.

Please let me know if I can provide any additional information.

title: Multiple instance: “kicad is already running, Continue?” (lp:#1835259)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1835259) created by **Timothée Manaud (timothee)**
```
Rationale:
I heavily use kicad for multiple PCB project (the lack of this support need
another thread).
Case:
Every time I launch a new kicad to edit the 2nd or 3rd board (stackable
PCB, etc...),I need to open another project, thus I must click on the popup
“kicad is already running, Continue?”.
Other case: PCB revision: if one need to compare 2 PCB revision, you may
need to open 2 instances to review them side by side.

While I understand users confuse application launcher with application
docker but is this really necessary?

Proposed feature:
Add a command line parameter to open a new instance without confirmation:
kicad --new
or
kicad -n

Option in Preference menu
```

title: pcbnew keepout zones fill changed (lp:#1835132)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1835132) created by **Seth Hillbrand (sethh)**
```
In the old fill algorithm, keepout zones did not have clearance attached,
so you could control the copper very precisely.

The new fill algorithm applies the copper zone clearance to the edge around
the keepout zone.

title: Current nightly build sometimes does not respect symbol-library pin line-width (lp:#1835051)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1835051) created by **Ron Burkey (rburkey)**
```
In the current nightly build, in a schematic I had created a few days
before, symbol pins all now display with a very tiny line-width.  (See
attached screenshot.)  If I add new symbols, they also have very tiny pin
line-widths.  I checked the symbol library, and there they all displayed
with their previous, normal widths.

In the schematic itself, I used the new Edit Text & Graphics Properties
feature to change all the widths, and the pins then displayed normally.  In
fact, everything worked fine after that.  However, if I exited KiCad
completely, and then reran it, the tiny pin line-widths returned.

For whatever it's worth, here's the schematic on which I was trying this:
https://github.com/virtualagc/virtualagc/tree/schematics/Schematics/2005273A.

Application: Eeschema
Version: 6.0.0-unknown-da71a51~86~ubuntu16.04.1, release build

title: Empty kicad_wks don't works (lp:#1834870)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1834870) created by **Piotr Gałka (piotrgalka)**
```
KiCad 5.1.2
Probably not a bug, but made some time ago decision with which I don't
agree.
I wonted to have no frame in PCB Editor but I found that if I delete last
element in Page Layout Editor then the deault frame is shown. I have
checked it is not only shown by Page Layout Editor but also if in PCB
Editor Page Settings I select my empty file then also default frame is
used.

I personally hate if program knows better then me what I wont and hope you
have the fillings about that like me.

It is perfectly good to use default if no file is selected to help the
users who don't care about it. But if I clearly define what I wont then I
see no reason for program to do against me.

Why I get into that case?
I didn't found the way to enter by keyboard the coordinates relative to 0,0
set by Space hotkey (and to see them in windows opened by hotkey E for
elements). So I decided to move my PCB to be around absolute 0,0 to avoid
continuous adding and subtracting destined positions from my point working
as a 'center'.
May be there is such possibility, I just didn't found, but even so I think
that it should be possible to have empty kicad_wks if user specifies he
wonts it.

description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1834718) created by **Wayne Stambaugh (stambaughw)**
```
I just stumbled across this beauty while testing another bug fix.  The
following steps cause the 5.1 branch of Pcbnew to segfault:

1. Open any board that has a filled zone on a copper layer.
2. Refill all zones (B hotkey).
3. Select any zone and move it (M hotkey).
4. Hitting the escape key to deselect the zone will cause a segfault.

This happens with both the accelerated and fallback modern canvases but not
the legacy canvas.  It does not appear to affect the master branch.  What's
really peculiar is that the gdb back trace complains about something being
optimized out of the WX_PROGRESS_REPORTER dtor (see below).  Running the

description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1834705) created by **Seth Hillbrand (sethh)**
```

Ctrl-Drag will deselect elements.  In pcbnew and modedit, Ctrl-Click does
nothing and Ctrl-Drag deselects

Shift-Click and shift-drag both select elements.

Our UX guidelines state that Ctrl-Click should be a selection toggle and
Shift-Click should be a selection extend.  I think Ctrl-Drag as a deselect
makes sense (no guidelines on this)

title: Symbol Library References dialog separates multi-unit symbols (lp:#1834509)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1834509) created by **Evan Shultz (evan-shultz)**
```
See the screenshot in the second comment.

In the 7th row, Q2A and Q2B are shown as separate symbols. In fact, they
are different units of a single part. I would think that one would always
want all units in sync, and thus the entire symbol (not each unit) should
be listed here (so just Q2). I don't see any facility to select individual
units,so the entire symbol is updated at once, which just means showing
each unit only lengthens the elements in the cell and adds visual clutter.

Naturally, I could be wrong. And it's a minor comment.

Note that this from the Raspberry Pi HAT template.

```

 At this point, the graphics appears like the main pad wasn't rotated, but
the main pad IS rotated.

orientation and the compound pad looks like in step 2.

the same, but they don't.

title: PCBNew crash on move hotkey while clicking (lp:#1834111)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1834111) created by **Dan Green (danngreen)**
```
Here's how I can reproduce this on OSX. It does it on every project I
tried, for example try the flat_hierarchy demo board.

1. Click on any text item to select it. (If it's a footprint value or
reference, then the blue line to the center of the footprint will be
visible).

2. Click on it again as if you were about to drag it to move it, but do not
move the mouse. Just click on it and keep holding the mouse button down.
Make sure you click off-center.

3. While still holding the mouse button down and making sure you didn't
move the mouse, press the 'm' key (Move hotkey). If you accidentally move
the mouse, the cursor position will jump to the text item center (or vice-
versa) and the bug won't appear.

4. The text item will jump to the cursor (or vice-versa?) and immediately
after that PCBNew will crash. In the latest nightly, it will pop up the
following dialog box, and then crash or quit no matter if you click
"Cancel", "No", or "Yes"

```
/vagrant/build/kicad/src/kicad/common/tool/tool_manager.cpp(513): assert
"!st->pendingWait" failed in ScheduleWait().
Do you want to stop the program?
You can also choose [Cancel] to suppress further warnings.
```

description:

```
on screen and plotted schematic differ (see attached image).

- Line width in 4001 symbol is different from line to line in plotted
version (may be in curved lines and horizontal body lines a different width
is used). On screen it is correct.

- Dashed line in figure is drawn in two different ways on screen and on pdf
file. To reproduce:

  2) draw the dashed line
  3) add the second port (I did copy it) over the dashed line.

title: Plot several layers to a single PDF or SVG file with the option of configuring the order of layers (lp:#1833391)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1833391) created by **Grzegorz Obuch (grzegorzobuch)**
```
I think a useful function would be the ability to print several layers into
one pdf, as in the attachment.
The file was generated using gerbv from gerber files, currently the
simplest method for me to make legible project documentation.
This requires the ability to configure the order of layers and colors of
each of them and a mirror image for the bottom layers.

Now, theoretically, we can print the composition of several layers from
KiCad, but without the possibility of configuring anything.
I tried to do the same with the use of scripts, but changing the colors is
also impossible in this way(or I don't know about something?).
```

title: eeschema copy-paste hierarchical sheet does not un-annotate components (lp:#1833205)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1833205) created by **Dino Ghilardi (dino-ghilardi)**
```
When you paste a hierarchical sheet, the components of the new copy are not
un-annotated, so you get double references in the desgn.

To reproduce the behaviour:
-Create a hierarchical sheet
-put a component in it (as a resistor)
-annotate the design
-go to the master sheet, select the hierarchical sheet box, copy and paste
-the newly created child sheet has still the components annotated, with the
same references of the copied sheet.

title: Project manager: right click "open directory" (lp:#1833052)
description:
[Original report](https://bugs.launchpad.net/bugs/1833052) created by **Timothée Manaud (timothee)**
```
Because the KiCad project manager handles project as a folder with extra
external resources, one may need to move, add, remove files.

Thus, having an option to open the current project folder in the default
file manager would be very handy, like: right click "open in file manager"
```
